channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for RI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for RI

item.title: Report E-2023030770
item.description:
Report E-2023030770

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T18:11:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-02
  • City: CRANSTON
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: xpo logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 3 of the metal 5 gallon enviroboxexes of floor stripper (un3267) had been crushed and had released 15 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023030774
item.description:
Report E-2023030774

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-03T18:11:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-29
  • City: JOHNSTON
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While performing dock check a supervisor discovered a drum that was wet on top. Further investigation revealed that the drum had these drain holes on the top chime and we area assuming that they must have compromised the integrity of the drum when they were formed and as a result led to the unintentional release. The material on top of the drum was cleaned with absorbent pads and the drain holes were sealed with putty and the drum is currently being held awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report I-2023020132
item.description:
Report I-2023020132

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: NEW PENN
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading, one drum was punctured by the forklift. The release was properly managed. The damaged drum was placed into a salvage drum and is being held pending disposition from the shipper.
